title: Ticket #6074: Be able to modify maxjobs for a running DAGMan
description:
As per today's LIGO phone conference -- this is something they're interested in.

Anyhow, LIGO is interested in admin users being able to do this for someone else's DAG.

(Also see #2616: Create a command-line tool to communicate with DAGMan.)

Hmm -- here's an idea for a simple way to do this: stick maxjobs into DAGMan's ClassAd, and have DAGMan either get notified when the ClassAd changes or poll the ClassAd (this could be used for other things, too -- there's a bunch of stuff we'd like to be able to change on the fly).
remarks:
2017-Jan-04 13:28:16 by wenger:
Hmm -- we could use the ClassAd mechanism for manually retrying nodes, also (see #2831: Be able to "manually" retry nodes during a DAG run) -- have an attribute like DAGManRetryNodes that's normally empty...

2017-Jan-06 11:38:07 by wenger:
Maybe also have an option that says, "re-parse the DAG file" -- this seems to be a somewhat-common case that we currently handle with condor_hold/condor_release.

We could try the ClassAd mechanism with a few parameters -- maybe maxjobs, maxidle, maxpre, maxpost, and if it works well, extend it to more things...
